name: CMMC 2.0
description: The Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) 2.0 is a framework designed to protect sensitive unclassified information shared by the Department of Defense with its contractors and subcontractors. CMMC 2.0 streamlines requirements to three certification levels aligned with NIST cybersecurity standards.

requirements.title: Level 1 - Foundational
requirements.description: Level 1 focuses on the protection of Federal Contract Information (FCI) and consists of 17 practices based on FAR 52.204-21.

children.title: Authorized Access Control
children.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, or devices (including other information systems).

children.title: Transaction Types
children.description: Limit information system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to execute.

children.title: External Connections
children.description: Verify and control/limit connections to and use of external information systems.

children.title: Public Information
children.description: Control information posted or processed on publicly accessible information systems.

children.title: User Identification
children.description: Identify information system users, processes acting on behalf of users, or devices.

children.title: User Authentication
children.description: Authenticate (or verify) the identities of those users, processes, or devices, as a prerequisite to allowing access to organizational information systems.

children.title: Media Sanitization
children.description: Sanitize or destroy information system media containing Federal Contract Information before disposal or release for reuse.

children.title: Physical Access
children.description: Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals.

children.title: Escort Visitors
children.description: Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity.

children.title: Physical Access Logs
children.description: Maintain audit logs of physical access.

children.title: Physical Access Control
children.description: Control and manage physical access devices.

children.title: Communication Monitoring
children.description: Monitor, control, and protect organizational communications (i.e., information transmitted or received by organizational information systems) at the external boundaries and key internal boundaries of the information systems.

children.title: Public Access Subnetworks
children.description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.

children.title: Flaw Remediation
children.description: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner.

children.title: Malicious Code Protection
children.description: Provide protection from malicious code at appropriate locations within organizational information systems.

children.title: Malicious Code Updates
children.description: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available.

children.title: System Scans
children.description: Perform periodic scans of the information system and real-time scans of files from external sources as files are downloaded, opened, or executed.

requirements.title: Level 2 - Advanced
requirements.description: Level 2 focuses on the protection of Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) and encompasses the 110 security requirements specified in NIST SP 800-171 Rev 2.

children.title: Access Control (22 Practices)
children.description: Limit system access to authorized users and control the flow of CUI.

children.title: Separation of Duties
children.description: Separate the duties of individuals to reduce the risk of malevolent activity without collusion.

children.title: Least Privilege
children.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts.

children.title: Non-Privileged Accounts
children.description: Use non-privileged accounts or roles when accessing nonsecurity functions.

children.title: Privileged Functions
children.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions and capture the execution of such functions in audit logs.

children.title: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
children.description: Limit unsuccessful logon attempts.

children.title: Session Lock
children.description: Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays to prevent access and viewing of data after period of inactivity.

children.title: Session Termination
children.description: Terminate (automatically) a user session after a defined condition.

children.title: Remote Access
children.description: Monitor and control remote access sessions.

children.title: Remote Access Routing
children.description: Route remote access via managed access control points.

children.title: Wireless Access
children.description: Authorize wireless access prior to allowing such connections.

children.title: Awareness and Training (3 Practices)
children.description: Ensure awareness and training of personnel regarding security risks.

children.title: Security Awareness
children.description: Ensure that managers, systems administrators, and users of organizational systems are made aware of the security risks associated with their activities.

children.title: Role-Based Training
children.description: Ensure that personnel are trained to carry out their assigned information security-related duties and responsibilities.

children.title: Insider Threat Training
children.description: Provide security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

children.title: Audit and Accountability (9 Practices)
children.description: Create and retain audit logs for monitoring and incident response.

children.title: Audit Events
children.description: Ensure that the actions of individual system users can be uniquely traced to those users.

children.title: Audit Content
children.description: Create and retain system audit logs and records to the extent needed for monitoring.

children.title: Audit Failure Alerts
children.description: Alert in the event of an audit logging process failure.

children.title: Audit Review
children.description: Review and update logged events.

children.title: Configuration Management (9 Practices)
children.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations.

children.title: Baseline Configuration
children.description: Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories of organizational systems.

children.title: Security Configuration Settings
children.description: Establish and enforce security configuration settings for information technology products.

children.title: Change Control
children.description: Track, review, approve/disapprove, and log changes to organizational systems.

children.title: Impact Analysis
children.description: Analyze the security impact of changes prior to implementation.

children.title: Least Functionality
children.description: Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions.

children.title: Identification and Authentication (11 Practices)
children.description: Identify and authenticate users and devices.

children.title: Multi-Factor Authentication
children.description: Enforce a limit of unsuccessful logon attempts.

children.title: Replay-Resistant Auth
children.description: Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for network access.

children.title: Identifier Disabling
children.description: Disable identifiers after a defined period of inactivity.

children.title: Password Complexity
children.description: Enforce a minimum password complexity and change of characters when new passwords are created.

children.title: Password Reuse
children.description: Prohibit password reuse for a specified number of generations.

children.title: Incident Response (3 Practices)
children.description: Establish incident handling capabilities.

children.title: Incident Handling
children.description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability.

children.title: Incident Reporting
children.description: Track, document, and report incidents to designated officials.

children.title: Incident Response Testing
children.description: Test the organizational incident response capability.

children.title: Maintenance (6 Practices)
children.description: Perform maintenance on organizational systems.

children.title: Maintenance Procedures
children.description: Perform maintenance on organizational systems.

children.title: Maintenance Tools
children.description: Provide effective controls on the tools, techniques, and personnel used to conduct maintenance.

children.title: Sanitization
children.description: Ensure equipment is sanitized of CUI before off-site maintenance.

children.title: Media Inspection
children.description: Check media containing diagnostic programs for malicious code.

children.title: Media Protection (9 Practices)
children.description: Protect and control system media containing CUI.

children.title: Media Protection
children.description: Protect (physically control and securely store) system media containing CUI.

children.title: Media Access
children.description: Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users.

children.title: Media Marking
children.description: Mark media with necessary CUI markings and distribution limitations.

children.title: Personnel Security (2 Practices)
children.description: Screen and manage personnel with access to CUI.

children.title: Screening
children.description: Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to systems containing CUI.

children.title: Personnel Actions
children.description: Ensure CUI and systems are protected during and after personnel actions.

children.title: Physical Protection (6 Practices)
children.description: Limit and protect physical access to systems.

children.title: Facility Protection
children.description: Protect and monitor the physical facility and support infrastructure.

children.title: Alternate Work Sites
children.description: Enforce safeguarding measures for CUI at alternate work sites.

children.title: Risk Assessment (3 Practices)
children.description: Periodically assess and manage organizational risk.

children.title: Risk Assessment
children.description: Periodically assess the risk to organizational operations and assets.

children.title: Vulnerability Scanning
children.description: Scan for vulnerabilities periodically and when new vulnerabilities are identified.

children.title: Vulnerability Remediation
children.description: Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments.

children.title: Security Assessment (4 Practices)
children.description: Periodically assess security controls.

children.title: Security Assessment
children.description: Periodically assess the security controls to determine effectiveness.

children.title: Plan of Action
children.description: Develop and implement plans of action to correct deficiencies.

children.title: Continuous Monitoring
children.description: Monitor security controls on an ongoing basis.

children.title: System and Communications Protection (16 Practices)
children.description: Protect communications and system boundaries.

children.title: Security Engineering
children.description: Employ architectural designs and development techniques that promote effective security.

children.title: Role Separation
children.description: Separate user functionality from system management functionality.

children.title: Deny by Default
children.description: Deny network communications traffic by default; allow by exception.

children.title: System and Information Integrity (7 Practices)
children.description: Monitor and protect system integrity.

children.title: Security Alerts
children.description: Monitor system security alerts and advisories and take action in response.

children.title: Traffic Monitoring
children.description: Monitor organizational systems including inbound and outbound traffic.

children.title: Unauthorized Use
children.description: Identify unauthorized use of organizational systems.

requirements.title: Level 3 - Expert
requirements.description: Level 3 focuses on reducing risk from Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs) and includes a subset of NIST SP 800-172 requirements, requiring government-led assessments.

children.title: Access Control Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced access control to protect against APTs.

children.title: Dual Authorization
children.description: Employ dual authorization to execute critical or sensitive system operations.

children.title: Privileged Access Protection
children.description: Employ organization-defined secure information transfer solutions to control information flows between security domains.

children.title: Awareness and Training Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced training requirements.

children.title: Practical Exercises
children.description: Include practical exercises in awareness training that are aligned with current threat scenarios.

children.title: Audit Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced auditing for APT detection.

children.title: Audit Analysis
children.description: Review and update logged events on an ongoing basis with automated analysis.

children.title: Anomaly Detection
children.description: Alert when audit logging fails and implement anomaly detection.

children.title: Security Assessment Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced assessment requirements.

children.title: Penetration Testing
children.description: Employ penetration testing to identify vulnerabilities on a recurring basis.

children.title: Red Team Exercises
children.description: Employ adversarial techniques including red team exercises.

children.title: Configuration Management Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced configuration management.

children.title: Authorized Software
children.description: Define and document a list of authorized software programs and versions and prohibit all others.

children.title: Automated Monitoring
children.description: Employ automated mechanisms to detect unauthorized software.

children.title: Identification and Authentication Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced authentication requirements.

children.title: Hardware Token MFA
children.description: Require multi-factor authentication using hardware tokens for all privileged and non-privileged accounts.

children.title: Biometric Authentication
children.description: Employ biometric or advanced authentication mechanisms where available.

children.title: Incident Response Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced incident response capabilities.

children.title: Automated Response
children.description: Use automated mechanisms to support incident handling processes.

children.title: Cyber Threat Intelligence
children.description: Identify and share cyber threat intelligence with appropriate parties.

children.title: Risk Assessment Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced risk assessment.

children.title: Threat Intelligence
children.description: Use threat intelligence as part of a risk assessment.

children.title: System Protection Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced system and communications protection.

children.title: Network Isolation
children.description: Isolate CUI or system components performing CUI processing from internet-accessible network segments.

children.title: Deception
children.description: Employ deception techniques and tools designed to impede adversary reconnaissance.

children.title: Diversity
children.description: Employ diversity in system components to limit the impact of a single point of failure.

children.title: System Integrity Enhancements
children.description: Enhanced system and information integrity.

children.title: Threat Hunting
children.description: Perform threat hunting to detect advanced threats.

children.title: Sandbox Analysis
children.description: Analyze suspicious files in a sandboxed environment.

children.title: Endpoint Protection
children.description: Use advanced endpoint detection and response capabilities.
